page.title: 08Arts and Crafts
page.content: The Granary Arts and Crafts Centre used to be a barn but in 1978 a preservation order was placed on the whole farm as being typical of the architecture of the time.It had been slowly going to ruins over the years but it had to be restored.It was finally opened on the third August 1983 by the Mayor of Scarborough,Dr.D. Jeffels.The Centre is divided into separate workshops.These include a carpentry workshop,a pot & china model shop with gnomes,wickerwork and stained glass windows on display.There are also over 50 fish tanks in the aquarium.The rooms are rented out separately for people to do their own hobbies in.Upstairs is a screen printing workshop,& a dress making shop,where prints are made for T- shirts.As the owners have day jobs the Centre opens evenings & weekends only.
